snippet.textDisplay: Ah this makes me wanna play diablo 2 becouse after playing diablo 3 beta i can say and be sure of how much better and harder (in a good way) diablo 2 is. Necromancer, no action house, non stacking potions, less inv space, less gear to add armor and magic stuff, being able to choose your stats,being able to quickly switch and use multiple skills, not needing to go into options to be able to place your regular attack back so you dont waste spells on breaking barrels and so much more
snippet.textOriginal: Ah this makes me wanna play diablo 2 becouse after playing diablo 3 beta i can say and be sure of how much better and harder (in a good way) diablo 2 is. Necromancer, no action house, non stacking potions, less inv space, less gear to add armor and magic stuff, being able to choose your stats,being able to quickly switch and use multiple skills, not needing to go into options to be able to place your regular attack back so you dont waste spells on breaking barrels and so much more

snippet.textDisplay:
Oh god, this is fantastic. Matt Uelmen is fantastic, and I agree that his music defined most of the game's atmosphere. Just hearing this makes me feel like only Diablo II, and those times playing it, can.

Thanks for uploading =)
snippet.textOriginal:
Oh god, this is fantastic. Matt Uelmen is fantastic, and I agree that his music defined most of the game's atmosphere. Just hearing this makes me feel like only Diablo II, and those times playing it, can.

Thanks for uploading =)

snippet.textDisplay:
Matt Uelmen isn't with Blizzard to work on D3 anymore and it totally breaks my heart. It almost kills my excitement for the game.

I also miss the 'classic' roles. Paladin, Sorceress, Amazon; all so unique. Not this obscure, blur-the-lines, classes they've been presenting :(
snippet.textOriginal:
Matt Uelmen isn't with Blizzard to work on D3 anymore and it totally breaks my heart. It almost kills my excitement for the game.

I also miss the 'classic' roles. Paladin, Sorceress, Amazon; all so unique. Not this obscure, blur-the-lines, classes they've been presenting :(

snippet.textDisplay:
I'm sure Diablo 3 will have the best hack'n'slash game mechanics, decent graphics and all the good jazz. But it will never have the dark, sinister, brutal atmosphere of the first game. Even the second game was a walk in the park compared to the original.
Sadface.

snippet.textDisplay: @xSayPleasex Yeah I know. But in the lobby you always had tons of players there and it just always felt like an MMO, but like I said, if you don't count it as an MMO I won't argue with you saying it is.
snippet.textOriginal: @xSayPleasex Yeah I know. But in the lobby you always had tons of players there and it just always felt like an MMO, but like I said, if you don't count it as an MMO I won't argue with you saying it is.

snippet.textDisplay:
@genesisSOC the thing is MMO is massive multiplayer online.... where'as D2 limits the game to only 8 players per "instance". The typical meaning of MMO is hundreds if not thousands all playing in the same world instance at the same time. 
Hope this clears up some confusion ;)
snippet.textOriginal:
@genesisSOC the thing is MMO is massive multiplayer online.... where'as D2 limits the game to only 8 players per "instance". The typical meaning of MMO is hundreds if not thousands all playing in the same world instance at the same time. 
Hope this clears up some confusion ;)

snippet.textDisplay: When I heard Torchlight's soundtrack a couple months back, I was hit with heavy nostalgia as I remembered this song :]
snippet.textOriginal: When I heard Torchlight's soundtrack a couple months back, I was hit with heavy nostalgia as I remembered this song :]

snippet.textDisplay: So many hours spent on this game, mainly with my Necromancer and my Assassin, but I pretty much played all the classes extensively except for the Paladin. I played a lot with my friend who had a Paladin so I felt like I knew enough about that class already. Diablo III is one of my most anticipated games but I have to admit I'm a bit sceptical, I'm not fond of the World of Warcraft influenced graphic style and I'll miss Uelmen's music which defined the series.
snippet.textOriginal: So many hours spent on this game, mainly with my Necromancer and my Assassin, but I pretty much played all the classes extensively except for the Paladin. I played a lot with my friend who had a Paladin so I felt like I knew enough about that class already. Diablo III is one of my most anticipated games but I have to admit I'm a bit sceptical, I'm not fond of the World of Warcraft influenced graphic style and I'll miss Uelmen's music which defined the series.
